intro: Ampalis madagascariensis var. occidentalis, commonly known as the western Madagascar ampalis, is a unique flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the undergrowth of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
